page.title: 02Swanbourne Church
page.content: The church,dedicated to St Swithun,was built in 1230 of smooth ashlar limestone and included the chancel,nave and tower.It is the oldest building in Swanbourne.The font is original. In the 17th century the tower and south wall of the nave were rebuilt.The north wall has paintings of Heaven,Hell,Death and Judgment of about 1500 but they are now faded and fragmentary.The church was restored in 1863 and the exterior stonework in 1973. The church was a place of refuge from the King's forces in 1643 when the villagers refused to pay 100 pounds. There are brasses and tablets to Thomas Adams murdered in 1626;Thomas and Ann Deverell who died of smallpox within ten months of their marriage in 1699;Josias Askew,lord of the manor,who died in 1750;the Fremantles.
